verse.name: v1
verse.lines: "Are ye able," said the Master, "To be crucified with me?" "Yea," the sturdy dreamers answered, "To the death we follow Thee."

verse.name: c
verse.lines: "Lord, we are able," Our spirits are Thine. Remold them, make us, Like Thee, divine: Thy guiding radiance Above us shall be A beacon to God, To love and loyalty.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: "Are ye able," to remember, When a thief lifts up his eyes, That his pardoned soul is worthy Of a place in paradise?

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: "Are ye able," when the shadows Close around you with the sod, To believe that spirit triumphs, To commend your soul to God?

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: "Are ye able?" Still the Master Whispers down eternity, And heroic spirits answer Now, as then in Galilee.
